writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
The best feeling in the world was waking up next to Nico di Angelo. The morning sunlight filtered through the curtains, casting a gentle glow over the room, and Will Solace blinked awake to the familiar sight of dark hair splayed across the pillow. Nico’s hair was always a mess in the mornings, like he’d been tussling with shadows in his sleep. Will smiled, brushing a stray lock from Nico's forehead, his fingers lingering on the cool skin.

“Wake up, my love,” Will whispered, his voice soft and teasing. Nico mumbled something incoherent, nuzzling deeper into the pillow. Will leaned in, pressing a kiss to Nico’s temple, feeling the warmth of his skin against his lips.

Nico groaned, eyes fluttering open, his dark lashes casting shadows over his angled face. “Five more minutes,” he grumbled, pulling the blanket over his head.

Will chuckled, tugging the blanket back down. “Come on, you know the rules. Breakfast in bed, remember?”

Nico peeked out, a reluctant smile tugging at his lips. “I love you even more for the breakfast in bed.”

Their laughter echoed through the room, a melody of warmth and affection. Will slipped out of bed, the cold floor a stark contrast to the warmth of their shared cocoon. Connie, their tabby cat, padded over, her tail flicking as she meowed for attention.

“Constable demands breakfast too,” Will announced, scooping the cat into his arms. Connie purred, content in the familiar comfort of Will’s embrace.

Nico stretched, finally rolling out of bed and joining Will in the kitchen. Their routine was a dance, a familiar choreography of making coffee and toasting bread. They moved around each other with ease, sharing small touches and playful nudges.

“Hey, Will,” Nico started, a hint of mischief in his voice as he buttered toast. “What if we did something different today?”

Will arched an eyebrow, intrigued. “Different how?”

Nico set the knife down, turning to face Will fully. “What if we had breakfast outside? We could take a blanket, sit under the tree, and just… be.”

Will considered it, picturing the two of them beneath the wide branches of their favorite oak, the sunlight dappling through the leaves. It was a simple suggestion, but it painted a picture of tranquility and togetherness that made Will’s heart swell.

“I love that idea,” Will replied, his smile wide and genuine. “Let’s do it.”

They gathered their breakfast, balancing plates and mugs as they made their way to the backyard. The morning air was crisp, the grass cool beneath their feet. They spread the blanket, settling down with Connie curled between them.

As they ate, laughter and conversation flowed easily, the world around them quiet and peaceful. Nico’s eyes sparkled with life, his laughter a symphony that filled the space between them. Will found himself mesmerized, lost in the moment, in the love that surrounded them.

When the food was gone, they lay back, side by side, hands entwined. The world seemed to pause, holding its breath as they basked in the simplicity of the moment.

“Every morning with you is perfect,” Will murmured, his heart full.

Nico squeezed his hand, turning to meet Will’s gaze. “And this is how I want it to be, always.”

With that, they lay in silence, the morning unfolding around them, unchanged yet forever different in the way it made their love feel new.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
The afternoon sun filtered through the kitchen window, casting a warm glow over the small table where Nico and Will sat, mugs of coffee cradled in their hands. It was a typical Saturday, the kind where they let the world drift by outside while they enjoyed the quiet comfort of each other's company.

Will leaned back in his chair, stretching his legs out with a contented sigh. "You remember Rachel and her on-again, off-again boyfriend, Ethan?"

Nico nodded, taking a sip of his coffee. "Yeah, the one who keeps 'accidentally' finding her phone unlocked."

"Exactly," Will said, rolling his eyes. "They broke up again. She found out he was checking her messages."

Nico frowned. "That's not cool. But why does she keep taking him back if she doesn't trust him?"

Will shrugged, a small smile playing on his lips. "Some people are just drawn to drama, I guess. But it got me thinking about us."

Nico raised an eyebrow. "Us?"

"Yeah," Will said, setting his mug down. "You know you can look through my phone anytime, right?"

Nico chuckled, shaking his head. "I don't need to check your phone, Will. I trust you."

"I know," Will replied, reaching across the table to squeeze Nico's hand. "But seriously, if you ever wanted to, you could."

Nico smiled, their fingers interlocking. "I appreciate that. But I prefer just asking you if I have any doubts."

The conversation drifted to other topics, but the thought lingered in Nico's mind, curiosity piqued by Will's insistence. Later, when Will was in the shower, Nico found himself glancing at Will's phone on the coffee table. It was just sitting there, unlocked, an invitation unspoken.

Feeling a bit mischievous, Nico picked it up. He wasn't planning on snooping, just maybe checking out Will's photo gallery. As he scrolled through the images, he noticed a folder labeled "Moments."

Opening it, he was surprised to find picture after picture of himself. Candid shots, each one capturing a moment he hadn't realized was special. There was one of him laughing so hard he was doubled over, another of him asleep on the couch with a book resting on his chest. In one, he was gazing out at the ocean during their beach trip, the wind tousling his hair.

Nico felt a warmth spreading through his chest, a realization settling in. Each photo spoke volumes of Will's love for him, capturing the essence of their life together in unguarded moments. 

Just then, Will emerged from the shower, towel draped around his shoulders. He paused when he saw Nico with his phone. "Find anything interesting?"

Nico looked up, caught. "I wasn't snooping, I swear. I just...I found this," he said, gesturing to the screen.

Will smiled softly, coming over to sit beside him. "I wanted to remember all the moments that made me fall in love with you."

Nico's heart swelled, and he turned to Will, pulling him into a tight embrace. "You're such a sap," he murmured, voice thick with emotion.

Will chuckled, resting his head against Nico's. "Guilty as charged."

They sat there together, the world beyond their walls forgotten, wrapped in the quiet understanding and trust they had built. In that simple, shared silence, Nico knew he had found something rare and precious, a love captured not just in pictures, but in every unspoken moment between them.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
Hello, my little hell spawns! Today is a very special day because I finally persuaded my boyfriend, Nico di Angelo, to be in a video with me! Yes, you heard that right. The Ghost King himself has agreed to let me, Will Solace, work my magic on his face. And trust me, folks, it’s going to be epic.

“Do I really have to do this, Will?” Nico grumbles, crossing his arms but already seated in the chair under the bright ring light. He’s squinting at the camera with a look that could wither a demigod.

“Of course, you do, tesoro! It’s for the fans,” I say with a wink, holding up my palette of colors. “Besides, don’t you trust me?”

Nico rolls his eyes but there’s a hint of a smile playing on his lips. “I trust you, sunshine. But I’m not so sure about your artistic vision.”

“That’s the spirit!” I clap my hands and lean in, rubbing our noses together affectionately. “Now, let’s get started.”

I begin with a primer, patting it gently onto his skin. Nico’s eyes flutter shut, and he lets out a soft sigh, his reluctance slowly melting away. I take this opportunity to pepper his cheeks with quick kisses, making him laugh.

“Stop distracting me, Solace,” he mutters, though he’s clearly enjoying the attention.

“So, Nico,” I say, picking up a brush, “what’s your favorite thing about being my canvas today?”

“Not being your canvas,” he deadpans, but there’s a twinkle in his eye. 

I chuckle and start applying a light foundation. “You’re going to love this, I promise. You’ll look like a dream.”

“Or a nightmare,” he counters, but he’s smiling now, and I know I’ve got him.

As I work, I ask, “Do you love me?”

Nico opens one eye and peers at me. “I tolerate you.”

I pretend to be wounded, clutching my heart. “Oh, the tragedy! But seriously, do you trust me?”

He nods, more seriously this time. “Yeah, I do. With my life.”

“Well, then, you’re in good hands,” I assure him, dusting his cheeks with blush. “Now, time for a surprise!”

I reach for a special palette, one he hasn’t seen before, and begin the transformation. I can see the curiosity building in his eyes, but he remains still, allowing me to work my magic.

Once I’m done, I step back and let out a dramatic gasp. “Behold, the new and improved Nico di Angelo!”

Nico turns to the mirror and his jaw drops. “Will, what did you do?”

His face is painted with vibrant colors, and he looks like a character straight out of a whimsical cartoon. His eyes are wide, cheeks painted with hearts, and his lips are a bold, sparkling blue.

“Surprise! You’re a carebear!” I exclaim, laughing as I watch his reaction.

Nico stares at himself, then back at me, and bursts into laughter. “Only you, Will. Only you could turn me into a carebear and make it look kind of... adorable.”

I pull him into a hug, pressing a kiss to his forehead. “I love you, my little carebear.”

And as we dissolve into giggles, I know this video is going to be a hit.
